page.title: 13Farming
page.content: There are a number of small farms in the area. The buildings on the majority of them date back to the early nineteenth century. Only one farm is still a traditional working farm.The others have been given over to the stabling and grazing of horses and ponies.We spoke to the owners of one of the farms -the Hare and Hounds- and he boughtthe farm with the intention of changing from "traditional" to "modern" farming. This change in farming is as a direct result of <a> a change in E.E.C policies concerning milk subsidies and<b> the exploitation of the recent boom in suberban horse and pony ownership.
